title: Marginal product of third worker 24 from table

content.description:
The following two questions refer to the data in the table below.

A perfectly competitive firm operates with a fixed amount of capital that costs <math alttext="$1,000" display="inline" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><mi>$</mi><mn>1</mn><mtext>,</mtext><mn>000</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> per day. Labor is the only variable input. The firm hires labor in a perfectly competitive labor market at <math alttext="$100" display="inline" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><mi>$</mi><mn>100</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> per day per worker. The table below shows the firmâ€™s production function.

content.question: What is the marginal product of the third worker?

choices.label: It cannot be determined from the information given.

unit.text: 3: Production, Cost, and the Perfect Competition Model
